programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: Dolly accidentally knocks over a glass of water on Berrys painting. The colors on Berrys painting get faint and watery. Berry gets mad at Dolly for ruining his painting. Later Berrys friends admire the little snails unique style of painting, so he insists that it was his idea to make the painting like this. But then Dolly arrives and sheds light to Berrys lies.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: At Ammas crèche a butterfly lands on Sulas painting. Bing tries to help it go outside but accidentally squishes it. Flop and Amma help the sad children say goodbye.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The playful rabbit wants to draw a big picture, so Flop finds him some chalk to create a stripy, spotty, zig-zag dinosaur on the pavement

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula find a potato in Amma’s vegetable patch with a comical ‘face’, so they take it under their wing, naming it “Nosey”. The two children look after Nosey and show him around the crèche but unfortunately Nosey goes down the slide too quickly and his ‘nose’ falls off. Amma shows them how to plant both bits of potato so that they can grow new potatoes.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing discovers a hole in his favourite yellow wellies but he doesnt want to throw them away in the stinky dustbin.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop hear the familiar jingle of Gillys ice cream van and race across the park to find her. After a long run Bing finally gets his ice cream but as he waves goodbye to Gilly he tips the ice cream out of the cone.

programme.title: Bing Bunny - Shorts and characters
programme.desc: Get to know our little pets better through charming stories featuring the characters from the popular Bing series.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon and Lou are making a snowman in the yard when they get hit by a load of snowballs, but they cant see whos throwing them. Can they find out who the strange snowballers are?

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: When Rosie, Scoutbadger and Woodsy are busy with their friends, Berry realises that she does not have one of her own. So, when she finds a twisted little branch that looks a bit like an animal’s face, she calls it Cherry, says that it is her friend and brings it in to be part of the family. However, Berry’s artificial friend starts to take up a little too much room.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The snow in the meadow is so deep that Little Nutbrown Hare has to stay under the Old Oak tree. Wondering what he is going to do all day in deep snow and with no one to play with, his imagination soon takes over as he creates new kinds of fun. By the time his friends reach him, Little Nutbrown Hare can’t believe how the time has flown!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On a cold but sunny morning in the middle of Winter, Little Nutbrown Hare discovers his friends ice-skating on the frozen pond. He decides to give it a try but slips, slops and slides all over the ice. Will he persevere for long enough to be able to perfect his own unique style, or will he be put off by the natural skill of his friends?

programme.title: Boribon
programme.desc: Home sometimes gets crowded, especially when theres a teddy-bear battle going on. There isnt enough space left for Boribons blue teddy bears. Annalee eventually finds a solution to the problem.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia discover in their secret hideout an old comforter that probably belonged once to a child from the Mouse Mansion. Who, among the inhabitants, loose this cuddly toy in his childhood?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Uncle Ramstout stored boxes in Sam and Julias secret lair. To avoid being invaded and lose their privacy, they must find a way to clear out his workshop in order to make room for those boxes.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: 24 days seem like a very long wait until Christmas. But the Triplets may have an idea to speed up time. What if they ate all the chocolates from their Christmas calendar at once? Of course, Mom is not happy and warns them: they had better be good, because Santa is watching and doesn’t bring gifts to kids who do not behave! Oh no, they only have three weeks to make up for a whole year of silly things!

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Mom is having a dinner party at home tonight and she is running all over the place to finish cleaning the house in time. When she goes out to do a round-trip to the bakery, the Triplets decide to give her a hand. But nothing goes as planned: the vacuum cleaner brakes, the couch is stained and the corridor is full of soap. Be careful Mom, the floor is very very slippery!

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: The Chuggineers are busy constructing a new station. Brewster gets under everybody’s wheels until Zack lets him take the welding wagon away to practice with. Down an old disused line, Brewster finds lots of old junk to weld together. Koko persuades him to go exploring along an overgrown track. They cross a dried out streambed and the rusty track collapses behind them, leaving them stranded. They both need to get back -­‐ Brewster has to return Zack’s welder wagon and Koko has a passenger run. Suddenly Brewster realizes that he might be able to mend the track by welding it.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Norman practices his magic act for the talent show, but it turns out that his assistant Mandy is better at magic than he is. But when he tries to make her disappear, he accidentally causes a fire. Meanwhile, Radar turns out to be quite the diva…

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Its time for the finale of the Pontypandy Festival - the Big Pontypandy Talent Show! But when Elvis knocks a drink over the drone control panel, the drones crash land, causing fires in the fields all around the show area.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Kipper, Tiger and Jake are having a day on the river. It takes ages to do up their lifejackets and Tiger loses his cap. Jake rows them in a circle and Tiger does a special knot to tie the boat up when they stop for lunch but it comes undone and the boat drifts away. By the end of the day they are glad to be back on dry land.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Kipper is waiting for Pig and Arnold at the duck pond when a small friendly robot clanks out of the water. At Kipper’s house it tries a piece of bread, a milk shake and some chocolate cookies but when Kipper introduces Hippo, to his horror, the robot eats him too! Happily Kipper and Hippo are reunited at the duck pond.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: Caillou is frustrated when he can’t score a basket in his new basketball hoop. After pretending he’s in charge of a space mission, guiding a shuttle pilot (Mommy) into a moon crater, Caillou learns to slow down and take a breath. This helps him finally score a basket!

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: When Caillou cant get the steps right to a block party line dance, he worries he’ll ruin the dance for everyone. But Grandmas story about square dancing for a famous square dance caller (Caillou) helps Caillou overcome his anxiety and dance the night away.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Thomas and Diesel are sent to collect trucks from the Ffarquhar Quarry, they argue about who should be the back engine. But then Diesel suggests he take the trucks with Mavis and leave Thomas to look after the quarry until they get back. When they don’t come back, Thomas gets fed up and decides to take another load of troublesome trucks on his own and then there is trouble!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Jayden is about to take a bite of his peanut butter sandwich before things take an unexpected turn when a crafty raccoon snatches his comms device. Simultaneously, Leo and Katie engage in a decluttering activity in the garden, pondering which possessions to keep or give away. They receive a call from Jayden but instead of seeing Jayden on the screen, it’s the raccoon on the run! Confused, this prompts the Junior Rangers swift response. They arrive and meet with a tired and lost Jayden who shows them the direction the raccoon went. This leads them near a road where the raccoon runs in the middle of it, which raises the rangers’ concerns about relocating the raccoon. They meet up with Ranger Rocky who calls Ranger Joey to provide insights into raccoon behavior and habits. Jaydens ingenious use of a peanut butter and jelly sandwich to bait the raccoon into giving back the comms device works but Ranger Rocky intervenes and reminds them not to feed wildlife but the raccoon scurries off. The day concludes with a successful mission and Leo, Katie and Hero continue with sorting their stuff and Hero lets go of his unused toy.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Farah, navigating the scorching Thar Desert, finds Hardwickes Spiny-Tailed Lizards seemingly braving the intense heat. Concerned for their well-being, she contacts Leo and Katie who are in the garden about to commence in a water gun chase but are interrupted when Hero steals the water gun. Upon consulting the computer, they learn that the lizards need sunlight to regulate their body temperature. During the call, a falcon appears and scares the lizards back into their burrows! Leo, Katie and Hero fly to the desert to help the lizards find a way to stay in the sun without being harmed by the falcon. Attempting to aid them, they construct a tent, only for it to crash to their disappointment. They meet with Ranger Rocky who seeks advice from Ranger Joey, they discover the importance of sunlight for these cold-blooded creatures. A lizard approaches the rangers, trusting them enough to be around them when suddenly the falcon swoops in towards it! Hero intervenes to protect the lizard from the falcon and it flies off. With Ranger Rockys assistance, they come up with a new plan to keep the falcon away instead of protecting the lizards. With CDs hung on a tree, it reflects light which scares the falcon. The lizards can now safely bask in the sun, marking the success of the mission. In the Treehouse, a water gun fight ensues between Leo and Katie.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Its Chinese Day at school and the children are looking forward to the celebrations.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: The children of Greendale have been practising for karaoke night.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing finds a frog in the garden, so he and Sula make the frog a house in a bucket.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to play his car park game, but Charlie is visiting and keeps messing it up.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop play shadow tag until it starts raining and Bings shadow is outside getting wet.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its Bings turn to choose a game at Ammas crèche so he picks Musical Statues but gets upset when he loses because he chose the game.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When Bings mini racing car and the cereal box collide, they make a big mess. Voo Voo the vacuum cleaner does his job well - maybe even too well!

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald inadvertently makes a date to watch TV with Henry at the same time that hes supposed to go swimming with Daisy. He tries to do both without telling his friends. But as he runs back and forth, he gets more and more mixed up, with hilarious results. Finally, he confesses the truth, and they decide to combine both activities so that they can all be together.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald goes out to get some cocoa and a newspaper for Henry, who has a bad case of the Arctic Sniffles. On the way, Oswald encounters his friends, who all prescribe different cures – soup, warm clothes, and cough drops. Oswald winds up laden down with the various remedies, and gets caught in a rainstorm as he staggers back home. By then Henry is feeling better, and Oswald is the one with the sniffles!

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: When Mila is appearing on the children’s TV game show, “Whiz-A-Quiz”, the rest of the Spring City Rockets are disappointed that they didn’t get tickets to watch and support her. This gives Mayor Madison the idea for Bob to build an outdoor movie area at the Stadium where everyone can watch the game show together. But when Mayor Madison asks Lofty to help the Spring City Rockets decorate the stadium, he gets carried away and leaves Leo to finish the support frames for the giant screen all by himself. A job that is too big for one person. When the giant screen arrives, the frame isn’t sturdy enough to hold it and the whole structure starts falling apart. Lofty races in and saves the TV screen but the frame, stage and audience seating are broken.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: JJ and Mila are training for a snowboarding stunt show to be performed at the opening of the Winter in Spring Festival - a celebration of winter in Spring City. Bob and the team will be building a triple chairlift to transport passengers to the top of Observatory Hill. But Bob isn’t keen on the cold weather - he’d much prefer to be building sandcastles on the beach! During a work break, Skye offers Bob a snowboarding lesson - and he’s terrible! Meanwhile, Scoop is determined to have a slide down the snowy hill - but Wendy warns him that without snow chains, he’ll have no control. Scoop can’t resist... and ends up sliding all over the slope and crashing into a support beam, causing the chairlift cable to jump off the wheel tracks.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse go on a long trip with Big Nutbrown Hare to find some food he hid away during the warmer months. Little Nutbrown Hare plays with a stick along the way, which turns out to have many uses, one of which is helping them find the food and another is finding their way home again.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is very proud of a Christmas Tree he has built from pine cones. So proud, that when Little Field Mouse accidentally knocks it over he has trouble forgiving her. When he makes a mistake of his own, Big Nutbrown Hare forgives him immediately, and he understands how important it is to forgive.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Seeing his tracks in the fresh snow inspires Little Nutbrown Hare to create a new game called ‘snow seek’. The friends have a lot of fun creating tracks for Little Nutbrown Hare to follow, but Little Redwood Fox’s tracks completely disappear and so does she. When Big Nutbrown Hare reports that Little Redwood Fox was sighted walking backwards, they work out how she managed to trick them all.

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Timmy likes football. What other things does Timmy like?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Huckle and the gang race all over Busytown trying to find the lock that fits and old key they found. They search everywhere from the Busytown Museum to Mr Gronkle’s antiques. They come up empty until they remember that an old roll top desk was being delivered to the antique store near where they found the key and had a lock on it. They try the key and it fits. / Chocolate sauce on Lowlys car leaves Huckle and the gang puzzled.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Captain Messy is in the garden playing pirates. Equipped with his washing up bowl of bubbles – the seven seas; a rubber duck – the scariest pirate ship; and a big stone – Boulder Island, he plays float or sink. But why do some objects sink to the bottom of the seven seas whilst others stay floating at the top? He journeys to Okido to find out. “Ahoy there me mateys”, shouts Messy, as he lands at Zoe and Felix’s house. Zoe and Felix invite Messy on a boat trip to see the whales of Okido who gather only once every year to sing a beautiful whale song. “A chance to go aboard a pirate ship! That would be brilliant!” says Messy “Let’s Oki-go Arrr!”

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy is in the living room playing his musical horn. PARP he sounds through a soft play tunnel but to Messy’s surprise he hears the loud PARP repeat back to him. That’s strange? He tilts his head inside “Hello?” To his astonishment he hears the same timid “hello” shout back at him but there’s no-one to be seen! Messy folds his arms and taps his foot “Well if you won’t tell me who you are I’m going to Okido to find out!” and vortexes himself to Okido. Messy arrives in Zoe and Felix’s garden. “Hello” shouts Messy. “Hello” Felix shouts back, but poor Messy can’t see where Felix is hiding and starts to feel uneasy.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Apple isnt paying attention when Strawberry describes their campout tradition of telling "Tall Tales." So Apple tells her thrilling adventure of a wild road rally she entered, only to surprise the girls by proving the story is actually true.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry decides to imitate his Mum by becoming a newspaper reporter for the day.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: When Harry is disappointed that he cant have what he wants for breakfast he goes to Dino-world.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers travel to the rainforest to reunite a Malayan tiger cub with its mother. But when the cub goes missing in some tall grass, the Junior Rangers have to put their heads together to find it.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Emily loves listening to stories of Nias travels - she has been all the way around the world and had some big adventures. It feels like ages since Emily left Sodor to go to the Great Railway Show - and everyones heard that story already. Rebecca can see that Emily is longing for a bit of adventure and so, when Nia is asked to take the Sodor Rangers up to Callan Castle, Rebecca suggests that Emily do the job instead. Emily ends up derailed and lost in the fog. But when Nia comes to the rescue she finds an exciting girls-together campsite! Emily and Nia camp out all night with the Sodor Rangers! The two friends return in the morning with an exciting story to tell!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas’ new Italian friends, Lorenzo and his coach Beppe, do everything together, but one day, Lorenzo decides he’d like to do things by himself for a change. Beppe is hurt when Lorenzo leaves him behind so he can deliver the legendary Opera Star, Bella Canto, to a music festival. Lorenzo meets his match in Bella - she’s a soloist and a diva who wants to do everything by herself, her way! She doesn’t let Lorenzo join in with her singing and demands he take her a different route. Not wanting to let her down, Lorenzo follows her command, but without his trusty Beppe – and his sense of direction – they end up lost! Luckily, Beppe knows that, deep down, his friend needs him, so comes to rescue and the pair are reunited once more.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: As every year, Maria is set to take part in the pizza contest. But she sprains her wrist at the last moment and, unable to cook, cant participate. So David asks Grisu to cook in her stead. Its the perfect mission for Grisu, who loves pizza (and his father even more). Maria instructs him – and Stella – on how to make the Pizza Nonna, according to her grandmothers recipe. But things go haywire, Grisu unwittingly ends up tied to the ceiling fan, spinning fast, kicking everything and making a mess in the kitchen, plus he burns the recipe. As all hope seems lost, Grisu, who never gives up, has Maria sing a lullaby, which makes her remember the recipe. Thanks to that, they make the best pizza ever and go on to win the contest.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Toramento has to decorate Dragontown with flowers for its yearly ball. But as he got the flowers delivered too late, he wont be able to finish his task on time. So David asks Grisu to help out Toramento and be his assistant gardener. The young dragon is in charge of making flowerbed depicting a volcano in the town square – even though Fume would rather have his son use cactuses instead of flowers. Things dont go exactly as planned. First, the soil is too hard, and then Thingy unearths most flowers Grisu and Stella have managed to plant.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Big Nutbrown Hare teaches Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends to play hide-and-seek, but the boisterous little hare finds it hard to stay still and quiet, especially when the Spring meadow is full of birds, butterflies and lizards to chase. When he does manage to stay still and quiet he finds the creatures of the meadow come to him… even very shy ones.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare finds a very special feather with bright colours, spots and soft tickly bits. Just as he shows off to his friends how it can fly and float, a cheeky bird flies away with it. Little Grey Squirrel climbs her tree and discovers the bird using it to feather her nest. Will Little Nutbrown Hare find a way to get his feather back, or will he decide that the bird needs it more than he does?

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Winter arrived early this year, and our dear family must get ready to face the cold for a long period of time. Edmund would like to extend the burrow’s food storeroom, but the vixens believe they had better spend the day outside instead and enjoy the sunrays of this beautiful day to collect strength and energy. The family finally decides to go outside… but to work...

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob must finish a Dinosaur Park attraction for the Mayor to visit that evening. This involves creating a trail around which life-sized models of dinosaurs will be positioned, climaxing with a roaring animatronic model of a triceratops. Muck starts to clear the main path. He’s fascinated, but also a little bit scared of dinosaurs. Leo reassures Muck by revealing he too was a bit wary of dinosaurs when he was small, and gets Muck to roar like a dinosaur. The model dinosaurs arrive and are very impressive. Scoop decides to surprise Leo and pushes the triceratops into the middle of the path. Instead of surprising Leo, they spook Muck who panics and knocks the model over a cliff.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob, Wendy, Leo, Scoop and Lofty are completing the second stage of a bridge over the River Coil in Spring City. This involves building a spar and building out a bridge deck, which is held up by cables attached to the spar. The bridge is due to be complete by Monday morning, in time for the city-folk to get to work. Scoop is sceptical about Leo’s claims to have caught a fish in the river; Scoop doesn’t like fish. The team learn from Mr Bentley that Mayor Madison has re-routed the next day’s Spring City Quarter Marathon to finish on the bridge, which means they need to finish the bridge by the end of the day. The bridge will be officially opened by the winner crossing the bridge finishing line. When Scoop dips his digger into the river he accidentally catches a fish in his bucket.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Huckle, Lowly and Sally set out to prove to Pig Will and Pig Won’t that the figure they saw wearing a strange yellow suit and helmet is not a spaceman from another planet. The clues finally lead them to the realization that it was really Granny Goodpig wearing her yellow suit to protect her while she collected honey from her beehives./ Someone took all the red roses from Granny Goats garden leaving Huckle and gang puzzled.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Wanting to practicing her ability to be stealthy, Farah sneaks through the tall grass to not be noticed by the birds shes approaching. But she steps on a twig, revealing her presence. Coincidentally, she finds a broken tooth to an unknown animal. She calls up the Rangers to ask for more information. Back at the ranger base, Leo is hiding behind a tree trunk momentarily before Katie calls out for him and Hero in a game of hide and seek. Hero hides behind a rock but Katie manage to see his butt. Their game was cut short when Leo receives a call from Farah, asking help on the tooth she found. After learning the tooth came from the Clouded Leopard, the Rangers travel to Farahs whereabouts to help her give back to the animal. When they arrived, Leo uses his binoculars to scan for the animal on the trees. Hero managed to find a tail nearby so he barks at it, alarming the Rangers. Turns out the tail belongs to a Long-Tailed Macaque, which immediately flee away from the encounter. The Junior Rangers were disappointed for their failed search before stumbling upon Ranger Rocky in a bush who were studying earthworms. They told Ranger Rocky about their mission, to which he contact Ranger Joey for help. Ranger Joey helps giving the Rangers additional information on the Clouded Leopard and its behaviors.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kyle is getting ready to dive into the sea, wearing his full diving gear. As he swims underwater with the fishes, he sees something struggling from a distance. Turns out its a dolphin and its stuggling because its trapped in a fishnet, causing Kyle to call for help. In the garden, Leo And Katie are playing with bubbles, having a friendly competition on who can make the biggest bubble. They get interrupted when Kyle tell them about the dolphin encounter. After learning about the animal, Kyle tell the Junior Ranger that the animal is squirming, scared that it might be in danger. The Ranger rush to meet with Kyle by taking the PlatypusOne. Once they arrived, Leo And Katie change into their diving gear. The pair jumps into the ocean, leaving Hero behind in the vehicle. Kyle tells the Rangers they cant come close to he dolphin as it keeps moving wildly and blow water out of its blowhole. Suddenly, the dolphin begins to cry. The Rangers have an idea that they need to play music to calm the animal, that is when Ranger Rocky arrive with his Umbrella Propeller and the Rangers explain the situation to him. Katie to begin playing music with her tablet, calming the animal momentarily before Ranger Rocky jumps into the water and break apart the fishnet with his bare hands. Suddenly, the dolphin barf out small pieces of food in a cloud of colored liquid, worrying the Rangers.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon and his family are spending the weekend at Grandma and Grandpas, but Simon is finding that he has to do lots of things around the house while Gaspard doesnt do anything!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Balthazar really gets to like the unknown bumblebee girl, and with the help of the friends he even builds a house for her.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry and Dolly accidentally ruin the snowman of Balthazar but finally they build an even nicer one jointly.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry and Dolly insist on seeing an octopus. They manage to get to the home island of the octopus and in the way back home rainbow-fishes help them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The violin of the poor Cricket breaks. Berry and Dolly takes care that neither the Cricket nor the other animals remain without instrument and music.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Dolly helps Christopher, the canary who broke his wing. In gratitude Christopher takes Dolly to the island where the yellow ladybird lives.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry visits his distant relative, Snail Sam.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is building a tower of blocks when Coco takes some to make a rainbow. When Charlie wants to play with the blocks too, they decide to make a new game they can all play.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: If youre very quiet and statue still, then the duckies will come. Today, Bing and Sula are at the park to feed the ducks. Sula is very good at standing still like a statue and only giving a small handful of food to the ducks when they come up to her. Bing, on the other hand, throws all the food into the water at once – not thinking that a big quacking goose will come along and eat it all in one bite!

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its snack time for Bing so Flop suggests they make a smoothie. When Bings carrot accidentally gets put in the blender, hes upset to disover he cant have it back.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing finds a frog in the garden, so he and Sula make the frog a house in a bucket.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: While Tilda is having a picnic by the river with her friends, Snaily creeps into the garden to look for food. He sees another snail that has fallen asleep on the wall of the house and is threatening to dry out. Courageously, Snaily saves the other snail, but in doing so gets trapped under a bucket.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: When Tilda one morning wakes up especially early, she is visited by Robin. He tells her that he as a robin wakes the sun every morning and invites Tilda to join him the following day. For this, however, Tilda has to get up at half past four! That evening, shes so excited she has difficulty going to bed early.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Rupert has always dreamed of living in the woods. And Tilda thinks wishes like that should be fulfilled. So Tilda, Rupert and Molly set out to spend a night in the forest. Rupert is amused by all the luggage the ladies are taking with them – for him, the woods have everything one could need! He soon discovers that its not that easy...

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse innocently pick lots of Spring flowers from a field and deliver bunches to their friends. When they realise that they are being followed everywhere by a cloud of yellow butterflies, they realise that the butterflies need the flowers, to feed from their nectar. How will they lead the little butterflies to more flowers and sweet nectar?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One clear Spring night, Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse settle in to enjoy Little White Owl’s story of adventure and treasures. Inspired by her tale, the two set out to try and touch the most special treasure of all – a shiny star. They climb higher and higher but the beautiful stars seem just out of reach. Will they find a way to get their wish?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare befriends a little yellow fluffy creature by the river, and it follows him everywhere, quacking and copying his every move. It’s too little to speak and doesn’t look like any creature Little Nutbrown Hare or his friends have seen before. How will he return it to its parents if he doesn’t know what kind of creature it is?

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Badge Quest is a series in which Wilson, Brewster and Koko attempt to earn a badge. Almost every character from the first season is featured in these episodes.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: At the base of the Andes Mountain, Peyo concocts a berry dip while Pico brings berries to him. Hearing a distressed animal, he finds an animal trapped inside a cave with its entrance blocked by a fallen tree. In the Garden, a duckling follows Hero around which Hero reacts by hiding behind Leo. They receive a call from Peyo and identify the animal as a Guanaco through the computer. With PlatypusOne, they reach the mountain, use a winch to free the Guanaco, discovering its a chulengo - a young guanaco. The chulengo follows Peyo closely, much to Peyo’s confusion. They decide that the chulengo should be with its family but they’re unsure how to transport it as it is afraid of PlatypusOne. Dumbfounded, they stumble upon Ranger Rocky who seeks Ranger Joeys advice. Ranger Joey explains Guanaco social structures and adaptations. The chulengo nudges Peyo which causes him to trip over a stone and a few herbs fall off from his satchel - which the chulengo eats up. This triggers an idea from Katie and the team uses Peyo’s herb to get it to follow PlatypusOne up the mountain to find its family. On the mountains peak, they find other Guanacos grazing and they reunite the chulengo with its group. Back at the Treehouse, a picture of the guanaco herd is hung, marking another successful mission. In the garden, Hero befriends the duckling, but it rejoins its mother.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Farah faces a perilous climb up the Caucasus Mountain, encountering an agitated East Caucasian Tur that leaves her stranded on a ledge. Meanwhile, in the garden, Leo is attempting to break his own time record of climbing a tree but a call from Farah interrupts him. Farah fills them in on her dangerous situation so Leo, Katie, and Hero rush to her aid. Upon arrival, they rescue Farah but discover a distressed baby tur on another lower ledge on that same mountain. They try to get close to it but the protective mother tur charges to them, endangering herself at the edge of the mountaintop. They meet Ranger Rocky who calls up Ranger Joey to know more about the tur. With insights from Ranger Joey, they devise a plan using bilberry branches to lure the mother tur away, enabling Leo to safely rescue the stranded baby. The heartwarming reunion of turs at the mountains summit marks the success of their mission, celebrated with a photo in the treehouse. In the garden Hero, attempting to climb a tree branch, comically finds himself stuck and Leo slides down to save him.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When he finds out that today is Nina’s birthday, T’choupi is eager to give her a surprise! And what could be better than have Dad bake one of his yummy cakes?! But to pull it off, they’re going to have to collect eggs and pick strawberries in the hamlet without Nina noticing. And given how eager she is to play with T’choupi, this is no easy feat! When she notices T’choupi is acting mysterious and distant all of a sudden, she even gets a bit annoyed, not to say offended…

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi is proud to have been put in charge of feeding Nina’s animals while she’s away. But when he accidentally drops some eggs and commits a series of blunders, the animals change their behavior, and even seem to start avoiding him! Are they upset with T’choupi for being so clumsy?

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi discovers Nina’s beautiful dried flowers. He’s so impressed that he wants to make his own collection, as a birthday present for his mom! So, he Nina and Benedicte secretly head off to pick some pretty flowers. But they’re going to have to turn it around fast: they only have one day to get the job done!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: In the forest, the teacher gives each pupil an index card upon which they will mark down the butterflies they see. Ben and Andy, eager to be free to play ball, jot down anything that comes to mind and drag Paulie off to play with them. Charley now finds himself all alone, having to track and write down all the butterflies he sees. He is very angry with Paulie…

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam, Julia, and the other kids in the Mouse Mansion read the adventures of Magic Mouse, a magazine hero. But one day, some of them are helped by Magic Mouse who seems to really exist...

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia always play together. Tonio and Ella challenge them to spend an afternoon without each other. But will they be able to do it, and even try to see each other without being seen?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Duck gets stuck on some flooded track, James is sent to fetch Rocky to rescue him. But James doesn’t wait for Rocky to secure his crane arm and they end up knocking down a signal before they arrive at the accident site. Without a signal to warn them, the other engines don’t stop, and what began as one small accident for Duck soon escalates into a much bigger one involving several other engines!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: James hears Duck talking about the slip coaches they used on the Great Western Railway, which could be uncoupled at stations without stopping, and presents it to the Fat Controller as his idea - but he soon runs into trouble.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillous class pet - Gerald the Hamster - passes away the night before Caillou is due to take him home for the weekend.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Rosie is scared to go to the dentist for the first time, so Caillou tries to prove its not as scary as it seems!

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The Pig Twins discover a puddle full of stranded goldfish. Huckle and his pals try to solve the mystery of where they came from. It turns out they were blasted out of the park fountain when an obstruction in the drain hole suddenly got unplugged./ A mysterious message on Sgt. Murphy’s radio has Huckle and the gang baffled!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Parrot is trying to rest when deflating balloons whiz by and we see monkey trying unsuccessfully to inflate balloons. Mole appears and tells them of how the puffer fish knows inflates like a balloon. Under the ocean Monkey sees Puffer fish inflated but when Parrot looks at the fish its deflated until finally they both see him and invite him to play Monkey See Monkey Do!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Sergeant Ravani announces that a special surprise guest star will be coming to the Big Pontypandy Festival to sing with Elvis! / It’s the Pontypandy Ocean Parade and Hannah is determined to beat the other vessels to the finish with her Submaster 2000.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When Professor Pickles decides to create an EPIC historical walking trail, he doesnt realise that his decision to use real props instead of cardboard ones will result in an emergency of EPIC proportions!

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: Franklin is having a bad day where nothing seems to go the way he planned. When he changes his attitude however, he has a blast at the First Snowfall Festival! / When Mr. Fox and Mr. Snail, Woodland’s newest volunteer firefighters, have trouble getting Mr. Snail into the fire truck fast enough, Franklin and his friends devise a customized firefighting bumpy buggy just for Mr. Snail! Franklin and his friends learn along the way that helping out is what makes you part of the team.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: The parents leave for an adventure and the children decide to have some big adventures too. For Scoutbadger and Rosie this means going far from the burrow while for Woodsy it means building some wings so that he can fly. But perhaps these big dreams are just a little too big ?

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: With just a few strokes of his pencil, Doodleboo always manages to do a funny drawing that comes to life as soon as it has been coloured.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: With just a few strokes of his pencil, Doodleboo always manages to do a funny drawing that comes to life as soon as it has been coloured.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Whats the best guardian of treasure? Doodleboo explains how to draw a Dragon

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave help Hatty deliver pumpkins to all their friends at Halloween. Their friends have all requested different numbers of pumpkins, as well as different sizes and colours, so they have to remember which pumpkin is for which friend and make sure they deliver them correctly. Dave wants to know who the giant pumpkin is for; but that’s just one of Hatty’s Halloween surprises - there will be costumes, pumpkin lanterns, pumpkin pie and even a party!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Hatty takes Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave to the big Countryside Swap, to swap things they no longer want or need. Hatty explains the golden rule of swapping is ‘once it’s gone it’s gone,’ but Dave insists that he’s too old for his cuddly blanket and wants to swap it. But as soon as he’s made the swap, he regrets the trade and wants it back! Can they trace the chain of swaps back to the new owner and persuade them to swap for something else?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is impressed by Blue Bird’s description of a flowery field that looks just like a sea of colour from her bird’s eye view. He visits the field with Big Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse, and they discover that everyone has their own unique view of the field, and each one is special in its own way.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One gorgeous Summer morning Big Nutbrown Hare wakes to find Little Nutbrown Hare enthralled by a story of Little White Owl’s. Encouraged, Little Nutbrown Hare sets off to make up a story of his own, but finds it harder than he thought to come up with one. With the help of his father, he finally uses some fruit he’s collected on the way to help him tell a very colourful tale.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare has a new game. He will be Big Nutbrown Hare for a day, doing jobs like finding food, answering tricky questions and resting in the grass. Likewise, Big Nutbrown Hare must take on his son’s jobs of playing with his friends, making up new games and asking questions. It’s all great fun until they realize that they are much, much better at being themselves.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing builds a house out of sofa cushions and Coco decides its perfect for a game of Big Bad Wolf. Bing enjoys being wolfie until hes not allowed into the house he built.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: It’s a hot day and Bing and Flop buy an ice lolly from Gilly the ice cream lady. Before they can eat them a frog hops into Bing’s paddling pool and they go to the rescue. By the time they return to the ice lollies all that’s left are the sticks and a plate of lolly goo.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing gets very enthusiastic when he and Sula paint a mural and his painting starts to drop all over Sulas. Sula is upset until she realises that the painting isnt spoiled, its just different.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing gets stuck when he takes a game of hide-and-seek too far.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop are building a sandcastle when Pando joins them in the sandpit with his wind-up digger toy to help. Bing finds a lovely ‘poiky thing’ in the sand and thinks it will make the perfect decoration for the top of his castle not realizing it belongs to Pando’s digger.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Easter is here. The girls: Dolly, Flutter, Leapy, Zephyr and Rosita gather and start to paint the Easter eggs. They happily work all day, painting beautiful eggs.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One night Berry is already in his bed, when he hears some strange noise. First he doesnt care, but the noise just getting louder. Finally he opens the door when the little green worm appeared. Long time no see friend just arrived.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One night, Berry and Dolly saw a shiny thing falling from the sky. Fearfully, they head to the depths of the forest to find out what the strange light might be. They found a star-shaped house and a girl.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Peppino delivers pizzas faster than anyone in Busytown, so when the kids wait an unusually long time for their pizza to arrive, they figure something must be wrong at the pizzeria. But Peppino isnt there and neither is his delivery car. By following his delivery route, the kids ultimately find Peppino stuck in an elevator./‘Fairy dust’ and strange sightings has Hilda Hippo convinced there are real live fairies in Busytown Woods!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Parrot suggests he should take some music lessons. Mole appears explaining how the cricket is world renowned for his musical abilities... They go to the meadow and hear the beautiful music of cricket who tells Monkey how he has been playing for years. Soon Cricket joins them in a fun game of Monkey See Monkey Do!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Pontypandy needs more bees! When Mandy competes with James to attract more bee visitors to her Bee Hotel, she knocks over Malcom’s smoker and starts a fire! The Firefighters rush to put out the fire AND save the bees.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: At the garage, Joe, Hannah, and James try to point a giant laser beam at the moon to measure how far away it is. Norman worries they’ll lead Moon Men down to Pontypandy, putting everyone in danger… but it’s his panic that ends up causing a fire!

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Tiger is spending the night at Kippers house. They are on hedgehog watch but every time the hedgehog turns up, they are doing something else and dont see him. Then they find a bite taken out of a doughnut. Kipper knows he didnt do it. Tiger didnt do it. So who did?

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Tiger and Kipper go to the park to try out Tigers new roller blades. Tiger crashes and hurts his thumb. He tells Pig hes so badly injured that he cant use roller blades anymore and so Pig can borrow them. But Pig is quite happy on Kippers roller skates and does a ballet dance to show them.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Tchoupi and Nina are very excited today as Mom and Dad have organized a treasure hunt for them in the forest! Tchoupi is very confident he’ll find the treasure in no time as he and Nina have prepared for it. As they move from clue to clue, the two friends have fun discovering other aspects of the forest, but Tchoupi starts to get impatient: why’s it taking so long to find the treasure??

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are busy playing as the chickens roam free in the orchard, pecking for food. But when it comes to bringing the birds back home, they notice Picorette is missing! They manage to track her down, nestling nice and cozy inside Loupiote the dog’s kennel, of all places! She’s come here to lay her eggs and she intends to stay! T’choupi and Nina try to coax her out with various treats… in vain. The problem is, Loupiote is out of a home right now!... But what if they were to find her another kennel??

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: The feather of a rare bird brought back from Julias island escapes from her own hands and flies towards the stairwell. A chase begins in the various air currents, involving Sam and Julia.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Ella demands to be the one who decides while playing games with Sam and Julia. But her two friends think the leader should rather be the one who is the most efficient at each game...

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Rupert builds a tree from wood instead of cutting one down. Soon, everyone wants one too, and the friends are so busy they forget the Advent celebration. The children decorate and save the day.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets have been playing outside in the rain and they are now filthy. It is high time to take a bath! The three kids hop in the tub, which turns into an agitated ocean, with lipstick goldfish and eye-shadow corals. After a crazy expedition and many splashes, it is Moms turn to enjoy a nice relaxing bath. But not for long...because she soon finds out that the Triplets have replaced the bubble bath with dish soap!

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Nini, the baker’s three-year-old daughter is completely infatuated with Turbulent. So when she gets to spend the afternoon with the Triplets, she is as happy as can be and already pictures herself marrying the little boy and having many kids with him. Poet and Girl have a great time teasing their brother and Turbulent is quite upset "We are not in love!" But the next day, the bakery is covered in hearts!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: The sure way of stopping the arguments between Rosie and Scoutbadger is that Rosie’s parents get back together… at least that is what she will try and arrange…

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: On a rainy day, while Mommy is out and Daddy is working, Caillou andRosie struggle with boredom. On a suggestion from Daddy, Caillou andRosie use crayons and their imagination to make their own fun, and tellthe story of Mommys epic quest to bring home pizza for their dinner.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou wants to be just like the Red Racer on TV - but hes tooyoung to drive a real car... Luckily, Mommy can build Caillou hisvery own Go-Kart!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When the Fat Controller gives Daisy the job of conveying some special passengers up to the holiday town of Harwick, she gets carried away with the responsibility – deciding that, because she is a very special engine, they must be very special passengers! Not stopping for a group of children with sticky ice lollies and refusing to pull a dusty baggage truck results in the passengers not being able to perform their puppet show! Once the audience has been specially bussed in for the show, Daisy is humbled as she becomes a puppet stand for the performance of… a Punch And Judy puppet show!

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Zephie, Wilson, and Brewster compete to be Kokos partner in a relay race, but Koko knows that Zephie is the weakest.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Wilson looks shiny and new after his trip to the Chug Wash and the other trainees are impressed - but everyone knows hes a magnet for a mess!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: In the forest, the teacher gives each pupil an index card upon which they will mark down the butterflies they see. Ben and Andy, eager to be free to play ball, jot down anything that comes to mind and drag Paulie off to play with them. Charley now finds himself all alone, having to track and write down all the butterflies he sees. He is very angry with Paulie…

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: A trip to Hatty’s garden shows Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave why apples are just so apple-fantastic - and good for you too!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi loves picking vegetables in the vegetable garden! But when Mom asks him if he remembered to water the tomato plants, as per her request this morning, he freaks out: he was too busy having fun and forgot! In a mad rush, he gets Nina to help him find a way to keep Mom busy while he quickly waters the tomatoes. But it just doesn’t seem to work: the plants look positively sick!... But, what if there’s another way to tend to vegetables…?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: As Kyle was kayaking near the shoreline to test his speed, he stumble upon a plastic bottle drifting in the water. He picks it up and notice a strange animal inside of it. Back in the garden, Leo And Katie are playing a guessing game. Leo sees a ladybug and have Katie guess it, which she has a hard time answering. Hero, their dog, appears and chase away the ladybug from the flower, causing Leo to lose their game because he cant show it to Katie. Leo then receives a call from Kyle who show him of the fascinating animal. After learning more information on Katies computer, the Junior Rangers agree to meetup with Kyle there to help return the animal to its habitat. Once arriving there, Kyle shows the Blue Sea Dragon to the Junior Rangers. Katie and Leo try looking for a suitable to relocate the animal with Katies tablet, unknowingly seeing that Kyle is attempting to open the bottle to free the animal. Kyle struggle hard and opens it, causing the bottle to go overboard. Leo And Katie looks back and realize the bottle isnt there. Suddenly, Ranger Rocky appear with the bottle, advising them not to litter. Kyle explains himself that he wasnt littering, but was freeing the animal. They see that the animal isnt inside the bottle anymore. The Junior Rangers lost the animal, which Ranger Rocky thinks its a good time to call for Ranger Joey with some valuable information.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: One day Dolly leaves for and adventure with Harry Hedgehog, so she asks Bubbles to take care of her flowers while shes gone. Bubble forgets to water them, so they quickly wither. Now Bubble has to find a way to make the flowers bloom again.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The residents of the forest decide to celebrate the last day of the year with music. The ants form a choir, Dr Owl becomes the conductor, and all the little bugs create instruments for themselves. But Iris, the icebeetle loses her bells, so everyone starts to help her find them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The boys resent the girls for not telling them what Christmas surprise they have in mind for the night. But all things go well, when the surprise is revealed and their old friend, the Stargirl takes them on a magical ride on her starship in the clear night sky.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The forest friends go for a walk in the forest, but Bubbles cant stop hiccupping. His friends try to help him by giving all sorts of advice. To eat, drink, hold his breath... But none of them seem to help. Finally, Stanley scares Bubbles from behind the tree. The hiccup stops, but now Bubbles is offended by Stanley. They all make amends later, after Stanley saves Bubbles from slipping into the creek.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The forest friends decide to help the Millerbug fix his broken windmill, but the wind doesnt seem to be blowing. Zephyr goes on to save the day, by asking the Wind to help the group restart the mill. Finally, the Millerbug can prepare his delicious bread.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: In the absence of a real plaster, Bing makes one out of sticky tape, but it’s so sticky that it hurts when he tries to take it off.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing loves Arlo the cat. They are friends. Bing strokes the kitty and they play hide and seek, but what happens when Bing meets a cat that isnt as friendly?

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop find a patch of fluffy dandelions and blow all but one. Bing takes the last one to give to Sula but when she hugs him to say hello, the dandelion blows away.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is vooshing with Hoppity around the garden, making him fly higher and higher. With one particularly enthusiastic throw Hoppity disappears. After a hunt, Bing finds Hoppity in the washing up bowl and gets upset because a wet, mucky Hoppity just doesn’t feel right.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and his friends play Nature Explorers in Ammas garden by spinning a giant colour wheel and then finding something of that colour in the garden.

programme.title: Bing Bunny - Shorts and characters
programme.desc: Get to know our little pets better through charming stories featuring the characters from the popular Bing series.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon has invited his friend Lou to his house so they can play with his new remote control car. But it’s best if they wait until Gaspard takes his nap because Simon is afraid that his little brother is also going to want to play, and that he’ll break the car! The problem is that Gaspard isn’t sleepy and has no intention of napping.. It’s up to Simon and Lou to make him tired. But they do such a good job of it that they too finally fall asleep!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Woodsy tried to take some honey from the bees and they chased him. He got such a fright that he no longer wants to leave the burrow. His brothers and sister will do everything they can to help him over his phobia.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse go on a long trip with Big Nutbrown Hare to find some food he hid away during the warmer months. Little Nutbrown Hare plays with a stick along the way, which turns out to have many uses, one of which is helping them find the food and another is finding their way home again.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is very proud of a Christmas Tree he has built from pine cones. So proud, that when Little Field Mouse accidentally knocks it over he has trouble forgiving her. When he makes a mistake of his own, Big Nutbrown Hare forgives him immediately, and he understands how important it is to forgive.

programme.title: Boribon
programme.desc: Boribon goes strawberry hunting. Instead of strawberries, he finds a series of objects: a pair of red shoes, a blue shirt, and a yellow hat. With their help, he finds Annalee, who knows where to find lots and lots of strawberries.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam And Julia

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia wonders why her mom store the gifts she offered her in the closet while Sams mom displays his on the chimney piece of their living room. Don’t she like the present her daughter gave her?

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: 24 days seem like a very long wait until Christmas. But the Triplets may have an idea to speed up time. What if they ate all the chocolates from their Christmas calendar at once? Of course, Mom is not happy and warns them: they had better be good, because Santa is watching and doesn’t bring gifts to kids who do not behave! Oh no, they only have three weeks to make up for a whole year of silly things!

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Shh! Let’s not wake up Mom! Today is her birthday and the Triplets have decided to prepare her a surprise: a nice cake with a poem and a beautiful necklace! But it is easier said than done and the kitchen is soon covered in flour and cocoa powder. They eventually decide for a breakfast in bed. After all their efforts they discreetly go into Mom’s room with the tray. But suddenly, Bang! The entire homemade breakfast falls on Mom’s bed. What a great way to start the day…

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Brewster is given the task of transporting the huge tunnel boring machine. A team of chuggers helps him, but one by one they all get called away or drop out. Meanwhile Old Puffer Pete rounds up a bunch of small and not particularly strong chuggers. Brewster is disheartened when they can’t even budge the machine an inch. He thinks hard and musters up all his energy to motivate them with an inspirational chant. It works and before too long they deliver the tunnel borer safely to the site.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Pontypandy needs more bees! When Mandy competes with James to attract more bee visitors to her Bee Hotel, she knocks over Malcom’s smoker and starts a fire! The Firefighters rush to put out the fire AND save the bees.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: At the garage, Joe, Hannah, and James try to point a giant laser beam at the moon to measure how far away it is. Norman worries they’ll lead Moon Men down to Pontypandy, putting everyone in danger… but it’s his panic that ends up causing a fire!

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: It’s Arnold’s birthday and he’s got some great presents. Pig has given him a cassette player – but the tape is missing. They want to play musical chairs – who has the tape? Everyone thinks everyone else has it until Tiger asks some searching questions. And the tape is in Tiger’s…. well, that would be telling wouldn’t it?

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Kipper thinks the Wonder Dog books are great and decides to be Kipper the Super Dog. His blanket becomes a cape and his bike a Super Bike. Now he needs someone to rescue. He makes Arnold’s kite fly when there’s no wind. But he becomes a real hero when he saves Jake’s kitten. Tiger wants to be a hero too. Pig asks him to rescue Arnold’s kite – it’s stuck in a tree – but Tiger’s not so sure when he sees how tall the tree is.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: When Caillou cant wait to open the mysterious box Daddy brought home, he imagines hes an explorer searching for the Lost City accompanied by his assistant (Rosie). By being patient, they finally find the city and Caillou discovers that some things are worth waiting for.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: When Gilbert decides to sleep in Rosie’s room, Caillou feels so lonely that he pretends to be a castaway stranded on a deserted island. To get back home, Caillou builds a raft with island buddies Teddy and Rexy and realizes that because he has his friends, he’s not alone at all.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas is on his branch line when a passenger pulls the emergency cable and he has to stop quickly. But it turns out not to be an emergency at all, but a bird watcher who’s spotted a rare bird. To make matters worse, Clarabel has a wheel flat after being dragged along with her brakes on. So the next time Thomas sees the bird watcher he refuses to stop to collect him, but he soon learns that that’s not the right thing to do either.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In the lush Amazon Rainforest, explorer Peyos discovery of a rare orchid takes an unexpected turn when playful pygmy marmoset younglings snatch it away. Believing them to be babies, Peyo calls the Junior Rangers - Leo, Katie, and Hero who were in the Garden, having fun imitating dances with each other. The team learns about pygmy marmosets, the worlds smallest monkeys from the computer. Arriving in the Amazon, they help Peyo to reunite the younglings with their family but first, they have to catch them as they keep jumping away! A spirited chase ensues with Hero, Pico, and the Junior Rangers pursuing the mischievous monkeys. They stumble upon Ranger Rocky who successfully catches one of the monkeys. Ranger Joey shares valuable insights into pygmy marmoset behavior. They find the monkey family near a river by finding trees with holes in them caused by the monkeys. But suddenly, Peyo alerts Leo and Katie of the monkeys playing on a branch dangerously close to the river. The branch snaps but with swift action from Leo, the monkeys are saved and returned to their family. Back at the Treehouse, Leo calls it a mission accomplished and finds Katie dizzy from trying to imitate Hero chasing his tail.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Jayden explores a North American beach with a walking stick, encountering seals, and discovering a blind pup. Leo,Katie and Hero are playing Blind Mans Bluff in the Garden before getting a call from Jayden regarding the pup. From the computer, they learn about harbor seals and realize the pup may be lost since the mother is nowhere to be seen on the beach. Leo, Katie and Hero travel to the beach, where confusion arises about the pups behavior. They stumble upon Ranger Rocky who calls Ranger Joey as she clarifies the seal pups natural behavior, and Ranger Rocky suggests the mother might be finding food in the ocean. After the call with Ranger Joey, they can’t seem to find the pup! Concerned about the missing pup and Hero, the group splits up to search and eventually finds Hero playing Blind Man’s Bluff with the seal. Ranger Rocky surprises them as he shows them who he found, the pup’s mother returning from the ocean! Leo concludes the mission accomplished before joining Katie and Hero in another round of Blind Man’s Bluff.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pat is delivering two things - Dottie the hamster and a didgeridoo from Australia.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Ajays organised a Summer Special day on the green, but the sun is too hot.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando discover a new climbing frame at the playground. It’s got climbing bits, tippy bits and even a wobbly bridge. But when Bing gets to the top of the slide it’s too scary for him to go down. Bing watches Pando to see how he does it, then he helps Hoppity Voosh to go down. When Hoppity likes it Bing has a go too.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When Coco and Charlie come to play at Bings house they measure how tall he is, but when they get the measuring ritual wrong, Bing is scared hes growing down!

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is disappointed he cant go play because hes all sneezy but Sula and Amma bring him a nice carroty bagel to help him get better.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is playing Hide And Seek at the crèche with Sula, Pando and Coco. Bing doesn’t go to the toilet with all the others before the game starts and when he needs to go before he is found he has to decide whether to give up his hiding place or try and hold on.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop are making ginger bunny biscuits for Charlie and Coco.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: When Henry’s Cousin Louie comes to stay, Henry starts feeling homesick for the Frozen North. He decides there and then to go back with Cousin Louie and a sad Oswald goes round Big City to tell all of their friends. They gather at the bus stop to wish Henry bon voyage when suddenly a gust of wind takes the party balloons up into the air – along with Catrina! Everyone ends up hanging onto the balloons for dear life and Henry realises he has to make a choice - save his friends or catch the bus…

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: While housesitting for Henry, Daisy breaks his favourite fish vase. Oswald advises her to simply tell Henry what happened, but Daisy, worried that Henry will be angry with her, is sure theres another way out. She tries to mend the vase, buy a new one, and make a replica, but all her efforts fail. Daisy despairs, but Oswald reminds her that she has ruffled Henrys feathers many times before and they are still friends. Daisy confesses the truth to Henry only to discover he has an entire cupboard full of fish vases!

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and his crew are finishing off the new penguin pool at Spring City Zoo. It’s almost complete when Lofty accidentally drops a large rock, which smashes the observation window. It’s urgent that they fix it quickly because the penguins will be arriving any moment. Meanwhile Mayor Madison and Mr. Bentley are entertaining a special visitor, the grouchy Mayor Snipe from Riverdale. They take him on a tour of the city, but he isn’t impressed with the castle, the sports stadium or the revolving restaurant.Back at the zoo the penguins have arrived, but the pool isn’t ready for them yet. Leo has been busy working on a new pond and water feature at The Town Hall, and Lofty suggests the penguins can stay there until their new home is ready.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team arrive at the Racetrack to build three horse stables the day before a big race. At the sight of the horses, Leo goes into ‘cowboy mode’ for the duration of the build. Henry Corner, the anxious groom, wants the build to be as noise-free as possible for the sake of his nervy horses, which is exactly when the noisy Two-Tonne arrives in reverse. The build progresses well, until, getting carried away lassoing with some spare ropes, Leo scares the horses, who escape from their paddock and kick out at the nearly-built stables in their excitement. The stables collapse like dominos! Bob and Scoop have to round up the horses now galloping around the racetrack while Wendy’s quick thinking and Lofty’s help steers them back safely into their paddock. But the stables still need to be built all over again and now it’s nearly dusk. A contrite Leo thinks he may have a solution, but what?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Field Mouse finds a sparkly rock and announces that it’s treasure. Little Nutbrown Hare wants a sparkly treasure too, so they set about finding him one that night, by the silvery light of the full moon. Together, they discover that treasure is found in the most unexpected places. When a very ordinary looking rock cracks open to reveal sparkly crystals inside, Little Nutbrown Hare realises that things are not always what they seem.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The Winter snow is softening in the meadow and Big Nutbrown Hare finds some beautiful flowers peeking through the snow, a sure sign that Spring is finally on its way. Little Nutbrown Hare decides he wants to show Big Nutbrown Hare something special too, something he has never seen before. With the help of his friends Little Nutbrown Hares comes up with a very special and unique treat!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse befriend a little green caterpillar but arent prepared for the changes it will undergo.

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Otus has a toy truck and the class have built an obstacle course. What shapes are the obstacles?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When Hilda arrives at Sallys dance party, shes suddenly struck with a severe case of the sneezes. Thinking shes come down with a cold, her friends take her to Doctor Lion who informs her she has an allergy to something. It turns out shes allergic to her best friend Sally - or rather, the new rose-scented perfume Sallys wearing./Huckle, Lowly and Sally find they have their mystery-solving hands full when things start disappearing, in the blink of an eye!

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world Messy is in the bathroom looking for his toothbrush. “My teeth are pretty dirty – even for a Messy Monster!” he says. He dives into the laundry basket frantically launching socks and clothes in search of his toothbrush but has no such luck. “But why do I have to brush my teeth? Why can’t I just clean them with water?” He transports himself to Okido to find out. Messy arrives in Okido where Zoe and Felix are cleaning a very dirty looking Okidoodle. “He went off road and got all muddy” Zoe explains. “Maybe we need to scrub it off?” Felix picks up a broom and starts to scrub Okidoodle whilst Messy sprays with the water hose. Together they make lots of muddy puddles!

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: It’s a grey day in the real world. Messy monster is looking out of the window and sees something he’s ever seen before. A beautiful arch made up of every colour you can possibly imagine appears between the clouds. Bigger and bigger it gets, as it stretches across the gloomy grey sky, but what is it? “When you need to know, go to OKIDO” says Messy and he transports himself to Okido to find out.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Apples rave review on her berryweb page of Strawberrys new dessert starts a booming mail order dessert business for Berry Bitty City. When Strawberrys stuffed-up nose makes her bake a bad-tasting cake, Apple, afraid the truth will hurt Strawberrys reputation, proclaims its delicious. The fib snowballs when the Queen of Berryvania reads Apples review and orders Strawberrys new cake for her ball. A madcap chase ensues as Apple tries to stop the airmail postal bees from delivering the cake.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry fails to see any benefit in rain when a visit to the beach is rained off.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry and Charlie have their football confiscated because they are unable to play football together without arguing.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers head to the ocean to find a home for a young scalloped hammerhead shark. Unfortunately, the adventure takes a wet turn when the hammerhead shark gets caught in a shrimp net.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Its Darcy to the rescue when Monty falls down an old mine shaft while working on the new visitors park.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas loses his voice trying to sing opera like his Italian friends, and tries to find a new way to pass on a very important message

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu goes to the desert (with Fume) as an apprentice paleontologist to help Smeraldo in his excavations, tracking the skeleton of the legendary ancestor of all dragons, the “Dragonosaurus”. They get caught in a sandstorm with Stella Olivia and Smeraldo and take shelter in what happens to be the skeleton they were looking for.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: The firefighters’s ladder has disappeared. Grisu and Stella conduct the investigation… They find some clues. Helped by Thingys sense of smell, Grisu follows a track that leads them to Daisy, the florist. They quickly realize that this is a wrong trail. Then, Thingy leads them to the pizzeria but its only because the dog is very foodie. Step by step, the mystery becomes deeper and deeper, and Grisu ends up feeling discouraged. But even if they followed wrong tracks, they also gathered information and clues that finally help Grisu to find the "culprit" who is none other than… Fume. In fact, he didnt steal the ladder but he borrowed it instead, leaving a note that Thingy has eaten!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One Spring morning a cute spotty ladybird lands on Little Nutbrown Hare and seems to want to stay with him. All his friends admire the interesting little creature and he feels very special indeed. When she eventually flies away Little Nutbrown Hare follows her, wanting her back. But he understands why she left when he discovers she has lots of tiny spotty babies.

programme.title: Dietrich Fischer-Dieskau : Dernières paroles
programme.desc: The great German baritone Dietrich Fischer-Dieskau was greatly admired for his interpretive insight, note-perfect control of the tonal qualities, and shadings of color in his voice, for exceptional rhythmic sense and impeccable diction. His reputation as a lieder singer is so high – he had a repertoire of more than 3.000 songs – that it is easy to forget his extensive list of operatic roles. In this conversation Fischer-Dieskau reveals for the last time on camera the secrets of his outstanding career. His ‘Last Words’ provide a deep insight into the extraordinary artistic life of one of the most famous and prolific lieder singers of our time. Dietrich Fischer-Dieskau died in May 2012 at the age of 86.Subtitles available for this program with your remote control
